title: Ticket #5832: condor_transform_ads bugs
description:
1) The rules file is: 
EVALMACRO ARG1 \$(argument)
DEFAULT ARG2 \$(ARG1)
TRANSFORM argument in (ClusterId, ProcId, AutoClusterId)

The ads file returned was written correctly as expected, but it also outputs this error message:

ERROR: EVALMACRO ARG1 could not evaluate :

ERROR: SET ARG2 invalid expression :

However changing 

 EVALMACRO ARG1 \$(argument)
to 
 EVALMACRO ARG1 \$(argument)+0
outputs no error.

2) The statement 

 TRANSFORM <int> A,B from <list>
only transform ads in the first transform if <int> > 1. For example, this rules file 
EVALMACRO ARG1 \$(macro1)
EVALMACRO ARG2 \$(macro2)
DEFAULT SIZE_IMAGE \$(ARG1)
DEFAULT SIZE_DISK \$(ARG2)
TRANSFORM 2 macro1 macro2 from (
ImageSize DiskUsage
ImageSize_RAW DiskUsage_RAW
)
would only add the new default attributes to the first set of each transform, but nothing to the second set.

Similar situation with 

TRANSFORM 2 A in (X,Y,Z)
